sectionText: This Act may be cited as the Criminal Code.

subsectionText: For the purposes of sections 606, 672.5, 715.37, 722, 737.1 and 745.63, any of the following individuals may act on the victim’s behalf if the victim is dead or incapable of acting on their own behalf:
paragraphText: the victim’s spouse, or if the victim is dead, their spouse at the time of death;

subsectionText: For the purposes of sections 606, 672.5, 715.37, 722, 737.1 and 745.63, any of the following individuals may act on the victim’s behalf if the victim is dead or incapable of acting on their own behalf:
paragraphText: the victim’s common-law partner, or if the victim is dead, their common-law partner at the time of death;

subsectionText: For the purposes of sections 606, 672.5, 715.37, 722, 737.1 and 745.63, any of the following individuals may act on the victim’s behalf if the victim is dead or incapable of acting on their own behalf:
paragraphText: a relative or dependant of the victim;

subsectionText: For the purposes of sections 606, 672.5, 715.37, 722, 737.1 and 745.63, any of the following individuals may act on the victim’s behalf if the victim is dead or incapable of acting on their own behalf:
paragraphText: an individual who has in law or fact custody, or is responsible for the care or support, of the victim; and

subsectionText: For the purposes of sections 606, 672.5, 715.37, 722, 737.1 and 745.63, any of the following individuals may act on the victim’s behalf if the victim is dead or incapable of acting on their own behalf:
paragraphText: an individual who has in law or fact custody, or is responsible for the care or support, of a dependant of the victim.

subsectionText: An individual is not entitled to act on a victim’s behalf if the individual is an accused in relation to the offence or alleged offence that resulted in the victim suffering harm or loss or is an individual who is found guilty of that offence or who is found not criminally responsible on account of mental disorder or unfit to stand trial in respect of that offence.
The proceedings for the purposes of paragraph (a) of the definition
paragraphText: proceedings in relation to an offence under subsection 7(2.01), (2.3) or (2.31) or section 57, 58, 83.12, 103, 104, 121.1, 380, 382, 382.1, 391, 400, 424.1, 431.1, 467.11 or 467.111 or in relation to any terrorism offence;

subsectionText: The proceedings for the purposes of paragraph (a) of the definition
paragraphText: proceedings in relation to an offence against a member of United Nations personnel or associated personnel under section 235, 236, 266 to 269, 269.1, 271 to 273, 279 or 279.1;

subsectionText: The proceedings for the purposes of paragraph (a) of the definition
paragraphText: proceedings in relation to an offence referred to in subsection 7(3.71) or in relation to an offence referred to in paragraph (a) of the definition

subsectionText: The proceedings for the purposes of paragraph (a) of the definition
paragraphText: proceedings in relation to an offence if the act or omission constituting the offence is a terrorist activity referred to in paragraph (b) of the definition

subsectionText: The proceedings for the purposes of paragraph (a) of the definition
paragraphText: a proceeding in relation to an offence under section 811 that arises out of a breach of a recognizance made under section 810.01 or 810.011, if he or she has given consent to the information referred to in those sections; and

subsectionText: The proceedings for the purposes of paragraph (a) of the definition
paragraphText: proceedings under section 83.13, 83.14, 83.222, 83.223 or 83.3.

subsectionText: The proceedings for the purposes of paragraph (a) of the definition
paragraphText: a proceeding for conspiring or attempting to commit such an offence or for being an accessory after the fact or counselling a person to be a party to such an offence;

subsectionText: The proceedings for the purposes of paragraph (a) of the definition
paragraphText: a proceeding in relation to a criminal organization offence that arises out of conduct that relates, in whole or in part, to any offence for which he or she has the power to commence and to conduct a proceeding;

subsectionText: The proceedings for the purposes of paragraph (a) of the definition
paragraphText: a proceeding in relation to an offence referred to in section 354, 355.2, 355.4 or 462.31 that arises out of conduct that relates, in whole or in part, to any offence for which he or she has the power to commence and to conduct a proceeding or out of any act or omission that, if it had occurred in Canada, would have constituted such an offence;

subsectionText: The proceedings for the purposes of paragraph (a) of the definition
paragraphText: a proceeding for the breach of any court order made in the course of a proceeding commenced or conducted by him or her;

subsectionText: The proceedings for the purposes of paragraph (a) of the definition
paragraphText: a proceeding for the failure to comply with any condition associated with the release of a person by a peace officer or other competent authority — including a condition to appear at a specified time and place — in relation to any offence for which he or she has the power to commence and to conduct a proceeding; and

subsectionText: The proceedings for the purposes of paragraph (a) of the definition
paragraphText: any ancillary proceedings in relation to any offence for which he or she has the power to commence and to conduct a proceeding.

subsectionHeader: For greater certainty — Attorney General of Canada
subsectionText: For greater certainty, the Attorney General of Canada or his or her lawful deputy may, in respect of an offence referred to in subsection (1) or an offence under any Act of Parliament — other than this Act or the Canada Elections Act — or any regulation made under such an Act, exercise all the powers and perform all the duties and functions assigned to the Attorney General by or under this Act, and those powers include the power to commence and to conduct
paragraphText: proceedings in relation to an offence under subsection 7(2.01), (2.3) or (2.31) or section 57, 58, 83.12, 103, 104, 121.1, 380, 382, 382.1, 391, 400, 424.1, 431.1, 467.11 or 467.111 or in relation to any terrorism offence;

subsectionHeader: For greater certainty — Attorney General of Canada
subsectionText: For greater certainty, the Attorney General of Canada or his or her lawful deputy may, in respect of an offence referred to in subsection (1) or an offence under any Act of Parliament — other than this Act or the Canada Elections Act — or any regulation made under such an Act, exercise all the powers and perform all the duties and functions assigned to the Attorney General by or under this Act, and those powers include the power to commence and to conduct
paragraphText: proceedings in relation to an offence against a member of United Nations personnel or associated personnel under section 235, 236, 266 to 269, 269.1, 271 to 273, 279 or 279.1;

subsectionHeader: For greater certainty — Attorney General of Canada
subsectionText: For greater certainty, the Attorney General of Canada or his or her lawful deputy may, in respect of an offence referred to in subsection (1) or an offence under any Act of Parliament — other than this Act or the Canada Elections Act — or any regulation made under such an Act, exercise all the powers and perform all the duties and functions assigned to the Attorney General by or under this Act, and those powers include the power to commence and to conduct
paragraphText: proceedings in relation to an offence referred to in subsection 7(3.71) or in relation to an offence referred to in paragraph (a) of the definition

subsectionHeader: For greater certainty — Attorney General of Canada
subsectionText: For greater certainty, the Attorney General of Canada or his or her lawful deputy may, in respect of an offence referred to in subsection (1) or an offence under any Act of Parliament — other than this Act or the Canada Elections Act — or any regulation made under such an Act, exercise all the powers and perform all the duties and functions assigned to the Attorney General by or under this Act, and those powers include the power to commence and to conduct
paragraphText: proceedings in relation to an offence if the act or omission constituting the offence is a terrorist activity referred to in paragraph (b) of the definition

subsectionHeader: For greater certainty — Attorney General of Canada
subsectionText: For greater certainty, the Attorney General of Canada or his or her lawful deputy may, in respect of an offence referred to in subsection (1) or an offence under any Act of Parliament — other than this Act or the Canada Elections Act — or any regulation made under such an Act, exercise all the powers and perform all the duties and functions assigned to the Attorney General by or under this Act, and those powers include the power to commence and to conduct
paragraphText: a proceeding in relation to an offence under section 811 that arises out of a breach of a recognizance made under section 810.01 or 810.011, if he or she has given consent to the information referred to in those sections; and

subsectionHeader: For greater certainty — Attorney General of Canada
subsectionText: For greater certainty, the Attorney General of Canada or his or her lawful deputy may, in respect of an offence referred to in subsection (1) or an offence under any Act of Parliament — other than this Act or the Canada Elections Act — or any regulation made under such an Act, exercise all the powers and perform all the duties and functions assigned to the Attorney General by or under this Act, and those powers include the power to commence and to conduct
paragraphText: proceedings under section 83.13, 83.14, 83.222, 83.223 or 83.3.

subsectionHeader: For greater certainty — Attorney General of Canada
subsectionText: For greater certainty, the Attorney General of Canada or his or her lawful deputy may, in respect of an offence referred to in subsection (1) or an offence under any Act of Parliament — other than this Act or the Canada Elections Act — or any regulation made under such an Act, exercise all the powers and perform all the duties and functions assigned to the Attorney General by or under this Act, and those powers include the power to commence and to conduct
paragraphText: a proceeding for conspiring or attempting to commit such an offence or for being an accessory after the fact or counselling a person to be a party to such an offence;
